entry.title: UACT embraces holiday chaos with 'Have Yourself a Crazy Little Christmas'
entry.summary: For many, Christmas is a time for gathering, family, giving and joy. For the Crowder family, it's also a time for drama, chaos and chasing down a loose pet ferret.

entry.title: Douglas County Fairgrounds temporarily closes riding arenas to prevent spread of equine herpes
entry.summary: In the cold and wet winter months, indoor facilities provide equestrians with a way to socialize and stay active with their horses. But in Douglas County, those equestrians may have to wait.

entry.title: DEQ fines Douglas County $35,270 for methane violations at Roseburg Landfill
entry.summary: DEQ issued Douglas County a $35,270 penalty for failing to conduct required methane monitoring at the Roseburg Landfill from 2022 to 2024. Regulators say the lapse is a serious violation that delayed safety checks and gave the county an economic advantage by avoiding monitoring costs.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.28.25
entry.summary: Wendi Patterson Communication Director for the Roseburg Stake – Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, and Colleen May-Weir of the United Community Action Network, talk about the Giving Machine at Valley River Center in Eugene, and the impact it can have on a number of charities, including several in Douglas County like UCAN.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN ANNUAL CHRISTMAS TREE LIGHTING ON SUNDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: November 28, 2025 10:50 a.m. The City of Sutherlin’s annual Christmas Tree lighting will take place on Sunday night at 5:00 p.m. The event will be held in Central Park. It is happening earlier than in past years, to allow the tree lights to brighten the downtown area throughout the month of December. ...

entry.title: Two meteor showers in December
entry.summary: A parade of Giant Planet starts as the sky darkens with Saturn and Neptune leading in the southeast tonight.

entry.title: Ask a Master Gardener: What's a strawberry tree?
entry.summary: Question: A friend was telling me they had a strawberry tree growing in their garden. I’d never heard of such a thing — can strawberries grow on trees?

entry.title: WINESGIVING WEEKEND HAPPENING FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
entry.summary: November 28, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Wine Growers Association has its Winegiving Weekend promotion happening Friday through Sunday. Attendees can give thanks and taste wine at twenty wineries across the Umpqua Valley. There will be Thanksgiving-themed pairings and live music at some locations. By shopping local, residents will enjoy limited-edition releases and can...

entry.title: FREE FISHING DAYS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AROUND OREGON
entry.summary: November 26, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife has free fishing days around Oregon, Friday and Saturday. That means both Oregon residents and non-residents can fish, crab, and clam for free. An ODFW release said statewide free fishing days are a great opportunity to take someone new fishing and celebrate Oregon’s...

entry.title: Chinese Xiang Cuisine Announces Closure After Five Years of Serving Douglas County
entry.summary: Chinese Xiang Cuisine is closing after five years of serving Douglas County. Owners Sami and David thank their loyal customers and brewery hosts for the support and memories. They plan to stay in Roseburg and are offering the business and food truck for sale.

entry.title: Douglas County Board of Commissioners enter bargaining agreement with Douglas County Sheriff's Sergeants Association
entry.summary: On Wednesday, the Douglas County Board of Commissioners approved a motion to enter into a two-year collective bargaining agreement with the Douglas County Sheriff's Sergeants Association (DCSSA), a union within the Douglas County Sheriff's Office (DCSO).
